questions.question: Which of these BEST describes how text elements affect this passage?

choices.answer: Extensive white space in the document distracts the reader.
Heading-captions give a preview of the content that follows
Varying print styles draw attention to specific information
Chapter headings concisely summarize the main points in the passage.

questions.question: What, according to the last heading, is "The Logical Decision" that the author is proposing?

choices.answer: that schools are out of touch with reality
that principals strive to keep more open minds
that students make service hours a vital part of their college applications
that schools need to require students to complete service hours to graduate

questions.question: The tone in paragraph 4 shifts from informative to persuasive. How does the sentence structure help create this shift?

choices.answer: The use of declarative sentences creates a persuasive tone.
The use of a sentence containing dashes creates a persuasive tone.
The use of the introductory phrase in addition creates a persuasive tone.
The use of an exclamatory sentence and rhetorical question.

questions.question: What is the theme of this poem?

choices.answer: Life is better when you are old.
The shepherd is nice to his love.
Life is better when you are young.
People often lie to get what they want.

questions.question: Which phrase BEST suggests the main tone of the last stanza?

choices.answer: petty and immature
rude and dismissive
pleasantly surprised
fanciful and wistful

questions.question: What does the word agitated mean in the second paragraph?

choices.answer: anxious
disturbed
happy
proud

questions.question: Which BEST compares the tone and formality of these two article excerpts by Sparling and Que?

Sparling uses a casual, informative style while Que writes descriptively.
